results.title: Broken English (A)
results.creator_credit: Ned Lander, Rachel Perkins and City Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Blood brothers (A)”.
In 1958, as a result of a forced confession, an inability to read or write English and the racial intolerance of the police and the community of the time, Rupert Max Stuart, an itinerant, half-caste Aborigine, was sentenced to hang for the rape and murder of a nine year old girl. Using dramatisation, archival film and interviews with those involved, including Stuart himself, this video charts the trial, appeals and subsequent attempts to overthrow the conviction.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ned Lander, Rachel Perkins and City Pictures

Using dramatisation, archival film and interviews with those involved, including Stuart himself, this video charts the trial, appeals and subsequent attempts to overthrow the conviction.

Using dramatisation, archival film and interviews with those involved, including Stuart himself, this video charts the trial, appeals and subsequent attempts to overthrow the conviction.

results.title: What is ecology?
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 1. Ecology”.
Introduces the study of ecology by illustrating the wide variety of interrelationships between plants, animals and their environment. Introduces the major biomes of the world.

results.title: The Temperate deciduous forest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 1. Ecology”
Illustrates the complex network of plant and animal relationships that make up the temperate deciduous forest community. Shows the adaptations of animals and deciduous plants to seasonal changes.
